title: Is it possible to access every device which is on the internet? - Quora

response.answer_text: As a purely theoretical exercise, yes, On an electrical level, everything has potential continuity. As a practical matter, no. Many hosts (devices) are behind firewalls or are on secured VLANs, and are therefore inaccessible to external access. Many other devices only exist in the context of a VPN, and unless they are advertised through a portal DNS server you won’t be able to see them using ordinary means. Note too that I didn’t mention any “Dark-Net” hosts which are not referenced by any advertised DNS nodes.
